messages.title: A track record of delivery
messages.content: Chris doesn’t just talk about making things better – he gets things done ... Bosworth needs an MP who will deliver for you and your family.

messages.title: No nonsense - the man for the job
messages.content: Forget the politics - it’s a job interview. The main priority for Bosworth’s next MP must be the day to day job ... You can see he’s a safe pair of hands.

messages.title: A fresh start ... Chris Kealey MBE
messages.content: Chris is standing to be the strong voice ... He will fight for the investment needed to protect local services.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Chris will oppose further cuts to local healthcare budgets.
Chris will support the building of local homes for local families.
Chris will fight against school cuts and for high-quality school places for every child.
Chris will back the high street and ensure government offers more support to local businesses.

mentions.tacticalSituation: Bosworth can only be won by Labour or the Conservatives.

issues.brexitEurope: Chris will fight for the best Brexit deal which prioritises jobs and the economy.
issues.economy: Chris will back the high street and ensure government offers more support to local businesses.
issues.education: Chris will fight against school cuts for high-quality school places.
issues.governance: Chris doesn’t just talk about making things better – he gets things done.
issues.health: Chris will oppose further cuts to local healthcare budgets.

housing.content: Chris will support the building of local homes for local families.

leaflet.personalStatement: I'm standing to be the strong voice Bosworth needs in Parliament.

contactInformation.address: Bosworth Labour, Promoted by ... Leicester Road, Hinckley, LE10 1AW on behalf of Chris Kealey MBE

images.caption: Picture of Chris Kealey with different groups supporting his campaign.
Picture of Chris Kealey talking to residents and business owners.
Picture of Chris Kealey with a young child.

leaflet.additionalNotes: The leaflet uses red as the primary colour indicating its affiliation with the Labour Party.
